subject: Ethics
title: Gerrymandering Ethics
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Gerrymandering Ethics.

hook.text: In North Carolina, Democrats won 50% of votes but only 3 of 13 congressional seats. The map was rigged.

buildup.text: Gerrymandering redraws electoral districts so one party wins more seats than their vote share deserves.

discovery.text: Both parties do it. The party in power draws maps that lock in their advantage for a decade at a time.

twist.text: The Supreme Court ruled in 2019 that partisan gerrymandering is a political issue courts can't fix.

climax.text: Voters are supposed to choose politicians. Gerrymandering lets politicians choose their voters instead.

punchline.text: When politicians draw maps, democracy bends to power.

quiz.question: What did the Supreme Court rule about partisan gerrymandering in 2019?
options: It ruled that partisan gerrymandering is a political question that courts cannot resolve
It declared all partisan gerrymandering unconstitutional
It mandated that independent commissions must draw all district maps
